<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 730, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 182]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 248]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 288]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 291, 752, 330]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 495, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 384, 427]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 534, 465]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 488, 336, 504]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 508, 428, 580]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 721]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 765, 242, 782]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 791, 594, 880]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C\] \[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 92, 885, 440]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 459, 148, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 459, 670, 480]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 641, 510]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 126, 554, 163]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{array}{c}{x + y = 3}\\ {2x - \sqrt{3} y = 5} \end{array}\]

Another curve has equation \(y = 2\sin 3x + 4\). Write down

<label>(i)</label>

the amplitude,

the period in radians.

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 720, 102]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\log_{6}(2x - 3) = \frac{1}{2}\). Give your answer in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 604, 920, 623]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 78, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 240, 101]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 72, 561, 102]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{\cos \mathrm{e}x - 1} +\frac{1}{\cos \mathrm{e}x + 1} = 2\tan x\sec x.\]

<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 500, 144, 519]]<|/det|>

<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression has first term \(a\) and common difference \(d\). The third term is 13 and the tenth term is 41.

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 379, 135]]<|/det|>

<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 395, 146, 414]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 395, 604, 414]]<|/det|>

<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 702, 92]]<|/det|>

<mark>[4]

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 74, 918, 109]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 4x^{3} - 4x^{2} - 15x + 18\). Find the equation of the normal to the curve \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) at the point where \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 918, 109]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 69, 756, 91]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS PART OF THE QUESTION.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
It is also given that \(x + a\), where \(a\) is an integer, is a factor of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\). Find \(a\) and hence solve the equation \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 137]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
